trans-unit.source: A connection to the server could be established. Unfortunately, the version information could not be retrieved.
You already have the latest version.
The new version [version] ([date]) is available for download on the Official Homepage.
A critical error occured whilst parsing the [file] file
The file system configuration could not be accessed or is invalid due to the following reason:
An older key-configuration file was found.
The current key-configuration has been reset to defaults.
The default key assingment file is an older version or corrupt.
The default key assignment file does not exist.
You are currently running on the [platform] backend. Please use the in-game menu to configure any joystick based controls.
OpenAL 1.1 is required. You seem to have version 1.0.
The OpenAL context could not be created.
The OpenAL sound device could not be opened.
An error occured whilst attempting to switch to fullscreen mode.
Please check your fullscreen resolution settings.
The selected route is corrupt: \r\n WithTrack section missing.
The selected route is corrupt: \r\n No stations defined.
The selected route is corrupt: \r\n No objects defined.
The selected route is corrupt: \r\n Unable to locate all defined objects.
The selected route is corrupt: \r\n Unable to locate all defined objects.
The train plugin [plugin] failed to load.
The built-in ATS/ ATC systems will be used instead, which may cause issues.
Attempted to create a package with an empty filename.
The directory in which you attempted to save the package file does not exist: \r \n
No write access available in the directory in which you attempted to save the package file: \r \n
Failed to create the following file: \r \n
Please check that this path is accessible.
If you are attempting to install addons in the Program Files or ProgramData folders, this may require administrator permission. \r\n\r\n This is not recommended for security reasons.
Use the train suggested by the route
The default train could not be found:\r\n\r\n
--- This train uses a safety system plugin which cannot be used on your operating system. The built-in safety systems ATS/ATC will be used instead, which might cause operational problems. ---

Click here to enable keyboard grab to automatically select the desired key.
Click here to enable joystick grab to automatically select the desired axis, button or hat.
Press a button or move an axis or hat into the desired direction...
Move an axis into the direction of "increase" or "power"...
Move the reverser lever to the full reverse position and press 'Next'.
Move the reverser lever to the full forward position and press 'Next'.
Move the combined brake / throttle lever to the full power position and press 'Next'.
Move the combined brake / throttle lever to the full brake position and press 'Next'.
Move the dynamic brake lever to the release position and press 'Next'.
Move the dynamic brake lever to the emergency position and press 'Next'.
Move the independant brake lever to the release position and press 'Next'.
Move the independant brake lever to the full position and press 'Next'.
Move the bail-off lever to the release position and press 'Next'.
Move and hold the bail-off lever into the full position and press 'Next'.
Move the wiper switch to OFF and press 'Next'.
Move the wiper switch to FULL and press 'Next'.
Move the lights switch to OFF and press 'Next'.
Move the lights switch to FULL and press 'Next'.
Attempt to fix transparency issues in older content.
Enable hacks for buggy older content.
WARNING: If you enable Input Device Plugin(s), these may conflict with one or more controls.

Some issues were encountered while loading the route and train.

As some files could not be found, the route or train might not appear as intended. Try to redownload the route and train packages in order to ensure that you have a complete distribution.

The following list of issues might give additional information. You can still start the route by selecting "Ignore" from below.

Some issues were encountered while loading the route and train. If you are the route or train developer, it might be worth taking a look at the following list of issues.\r\n\r\nAs a regular user, you can select "Ignore" at this point to start the game.
You may proceed at [speed] [unit] with extreme caution.
You have passed a stop signal. Please apply the emergency brakes immediately and come to a complete hold.
The signal indicates a speed limit of [limit] [unit]. You are currently traveling at [speed] [unit]. Please slow down.
The speed post indicates a speed limit of [limit] [unit]. You are currently traveling at [speed] [unit]. Please slow down.
You have arrived at [name] and are [time] late.
You have arrived at [name] and are [time] early.
Boarding complete. You may close the doors now.
You have passed [name] where you should have stopped.
You have passed [name] while still boarding. Please come to a complete hold immediately.
This feature is not available in Expert mode.
The AI might be unable to fully operate this train.
Do you really want to exit to the main menu?
Do you really want to quit?
Please press any key or move a joystick axis to set this control...
Increases power by one notch for trains with two handles
Decreases power by one notch for trains with two handles
Controls power for trains with two handles on half of a joystick axis
Controls power for trains with two handles on a full joystick axis
Decreases brake by one notch for trains with two handles
Increases brake by one notch for trains with two handles
Controls brake for trains with two handles on half of a joystick axis
Controls brake for trains with two handles on a full joystick axis
Activates emergency brakes for trains with two handles
Moves handle toward power by one notch for trains with one handle
Moves handle toward neutral by one notch for trains with one handle
Moves handle toward brake by one notch for trains with one handle
Activates emergency brake for trains with one handle
Controls power and brake for trains with one handle on a full joystick axis
Adjusts the power notch directly from a command option value.
Adjusts the brake notch directly from a command option value.
Adjusts the reverser directly from a command option value.
Moves reverser forward by one notch
Moves reverser backward by one notch
Controls reverser on a full joystick axis
Opens or closes the left doors
Opens or closes the right doors
Plays or stops the music horn
Activates or deactivates the constant speed device
Activates or deactivates the security system on some trains
The S function of the security system
The A1 function of the security system
The A2 function of the security system
The B1 function of the security system
The B2 function of the security system
The C1 function of the security system
The C2 function of the security system
The D function of the security system
The E function of the security system
The F function of the security system
The G function of the security system
The H function of the security system
The I function of the security system
The J function of the security system
The K function of the security system
The L function of the security system
Switches to the train's interior view
Switches to the train's interior view. However, the panel is not displayed.
Switches to the train's exterior view
Jumps to the previous point of interest in the route.
Jumps to the next point of interest in the route.
Resets the camera view to default values
Activates or deactivates interior view camera restriction
Moves the cursor up within the in-game menu
Moves the cursor down within the in-game menu
Performs the selected command within the in-game menu
Goes back within the in-game menu
Toggles through different speed display modes
Toggles through different gradient display modes
Toggles through different next station remain distance display modes
Toggles through different time acceleration factors
Shows or hides the frame rate display
Activates or deactivates the virtual driver (AI)
Toggles to or from fullscreen mode
Mutes sound or resumes playing sounds
Switches to or from reduced CPU mode
Shows or hides brake system debug output
Shows or hides plugin debug output
Shows or hides the touch range
Shows or hides the route information window
Shows or hides event markers (For developers)
Increases the speed of the windscreen wipers
Decreases the speed of the windscreen wipers
Activates or deactivates the live steam injector
Activates or deactivates the exhaust steam injector
Shifts up a gear in a train fitted with a gearbox
Shifts down a gear in a train fitted with a gearbox
Toggles the RailDriver speed display units.
Hold the [button] button in the controller and press OK.
Move the brake handle to [notch] and press OK.
Move the power handle to [notch] and press OK.
My controller is not detected or does not work properly
My controller is not working correctly
My PS2 controller is not detected

If your non-USB controller is not providing correct input:
1. Ensure the USB adapter is working. Ideally, the adapter should map the direction buttons from a standard controller to separate buttons to avoid compatibility issues. 2. Calibrate the controller from the configuration window, if necessary.
If your PS2 controller does not appear in the list, follow these steps:

1. Extract the Windows drivers. 2. Download and run Zadig. 3. Load the appropriate CFG file for your device ("Device > Load Preset Device"). 4. Press "Install Driver" and wait for installation to complete.
1. Extract the Linux udev file. 2. Copy the file to "/etc/udev/rules.d/" (root permissions required). 3. Reboot or reload udev rules manually.

LibUsb appears to be either missing, or has not been correctly symlinked for runtime loading. Please follow the following instructions:
1. Check that the "libusb-1.0" package is installed. 2. Find the location of "libusb-1.0.so.0" - On recent Ubuntu and Debian versions, this is likely to be "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/" 3. Open the directory in the terminal. 4. Check this location to see if "libusb-1.0.so" exists. 5. If the file does not exist, we must create the appropriate symlink by executing the following command from this terminal: "sudo ln -s libusb-1.0.so.0 libusb-1.0.so"
Do you want to save data before creating a new train?
Do you want to save data before opening another train?
Do you want to save data before closing?
Electro-pneumatic air brake without brake pipe
Air brake with partial release feature
BrakeNotches must be at least 1 if HoldBrake is set.
DriverPowerNotches must be less than or equal to PowerNotches.
DriverBrakeNotches must be less than or equal to BrakeNotches.
DriverCar must be less than NumberOfMotorCars + NumberOfTrailerCars.
NumberOfTrailerCars must be at least 1 if FrontCarIsAMotorCar is not set.
Subtract deceleration due to air and rolling resistance
Please note: Features found on this page may require the following minimum version of openBVE:
Return Power and Reverser to neutral
